t: Matthew 9
Jesus Forgives and Heals a Paralytic
So*p He got into a boat, crossed over, and came to His own city.
Then behold, they brought to Him a paralytic lying on a bed. When Jesus saw their faith, He said to the paralytic, “Son,*r be*r of*r good*r cheer;*r your*r sins*r are*r forgiven*r you.”*r
And*p at once some of the scribes said within themselves, “This Man blasphemes!”
But*p Jesus, knowing their thoughts, said, “Why*r do*r you*r think*r evil*r in*r your*r hearts?*r
For*r which*r is*r easier,*r to*r say,*r ‘Your*ir sins*r are*r forgiven*r you,’*r or*r to*r say,*r ‘Arise*r and*r walk’?*r

But*r that*r you*r may*r know*r that*r the*r Son*r of*r Man*r has*r power*r on*r earth*r to*r forgive*r sins”*r —then He said to the paralytic, “Arise,*r take*r up*r your*r bed,*r and*r go*r to*r your*r house.”*r
And he arose and departed to his house.
Now*p when the multitudes saw it,*i they marveled and glorified God, who had given such power to men.
Matthew the Tax Collector
As*p Jesus passed on from there, He saw a man named Matthew sitting at the tax office. And He said to him, “Follow*r Me.”*r So he arose and followed Him.
Now*p it happened, as Jesus sat at the table in the house, that*i behold, many tax collectors and sinners came and sat down with Him and His disciples.
And when the Pharisees saw it,*i they said to His disciples, “Why does your Teacher eat with tax collectors and sinners?”
When*p Jesus heard that,*i He said to them, “Those*r who*r are*r well*r have*r no*r need*r of*r a*r physician,*r but*r those*r who*r are*r sick.*r
But*r go*r and*r learn*r what*r this*ir means:*r ‘I*r desire*r mercy*r and*r not*r sacrifice.’*r For*r I*r did*r not*r come*r to*r call*r the*r righteous,*r but*r sinners,*r to*r repentance.”*r
Jesus Is Questioned About Fasting
Then*p the disciples of John came to Him, saying, “Why do we and the Pharisees fast often, but Your disciples do not fast?”

And*p Jesus said to them, “Can*r the*r friends*r of*r the*r bridegroom*r mourn*r as*r long*r as*r the*r bridegroom*r is*r with*r them?*r But*r the*r days*r will*r come*r when*r the*r bridegroom*r will*r be*r taken*r away*r from*r them,*r and*r then*r they*r will*r fast.*r
No*r one*r puts*r a*r piece*r of*r unshrunk*r cloth*r on*r an*r old*r garment;*r for*r the*r patch*r pulls*r away*r from*r the*r garment,*r and*r the*r tear*r is*r made*r worse.*r

Nor*r do*r they*r put*r new*r wine*r into*r old*r wineskins,*r or*r else*r the*r wineskins*r break,*r the*r wine*r is*r spilled,*r and*r the*r wineskins*r are*r ruined.*r But*r they*r put*r new*r wine*r into*r new*r wineskins,*r and*r both*r are*r preserved.”*r
A Girl Restored to Life and a Woman Healed
While*p He spoke these things to them, behold, a ruler came and worshiped Him, saying, “My daughter has just died, but come and lay Your hand on her and she will live.”
So Jesus arose and followed him, and so did*i His disciples.
And*p suddenly, a woman who had a flow of blood for twelve years came from behind and touched the hem of His garment.
For she said to herself, “If only I may touch His garment, I shall be made well.”
But Jesus turned around, and when He saw her He said, “Be*r of*r good*r cheer,*r daughter;*r your*r faith*r has*r made*r you*r well.”*r And the woman was made well from that hour.
When*p Jesus came into the ruler’s house, and saw the flute players and the noisy crowd wailing,
He said to them, “Make*r room,*r for*r the*r girl*r is*r not*r dead,*r but*r sleeping.”*r And they ridiculed Him.
But when the crowd was put outside, He went in and took her by the hand, and the girl arose.
And the report of this went out into all that land.
Two Blind Men Healed
When*p Jesus departed from there, two blind men followed Him, crying out and saying, “Son of David, have mercy on us!”
And*p when He had come into the house, the blind men came to Him. And Jesus said to them, “Do*r you*r believe*r that*r I*r am*r able*r to*r do*r this?”*r They*p said to Him, “Yes, Lord.”
Then*p He touched their eyes, saying, “According*r to*r your*r faith*r let*r it*r be*r to*r you.”*r
And their eyes were opened. And Jesus sternly warned them, saying, “See*r that*ir no*r one*r knows*r it.”*ir
But when they had departed, they spread the news about Him in all that country.
A Mute Man Speaks
As*p they went out, behold, they brought to Him a man, mute and demon-possessed.
And when the demon was cast out, the mute spoke. And the multitudes marveled, saying, “It was never seen like this in Israel!”
But*p the Pharisees said, “He casts out demons by the ruler of the demons.”
The Compassion of Jesus
Then*p Jesus went about all the cities and villages, teaching in their synagogues, preaching the gospel of the kingdom, and healing every sickness and every disease among the people.
But when He saw the multitudes, He was moved with compassion for them, because they were weary and scattered, like sheep having no shepherd.
Then He said to His disciples, “The*r harvest*r truly*r is*ir plentiful,*r but*r the*r laborers*r are*ir few.*r
Therefore*r pray*r the*r Lord*r of*r the*r harvest*r to*r send*r out*r laborers*r into*r His*r harvest.”*r
